CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: their ter-polymers containing perylene units were synthesized using Suzuki coupling polymerization. The perylene units were introduced to improve the charge - transport ability by enhancing the π-π interaction between polymer chains. The resulting polymers were characterized by 1H NMR , elemental analysis , DSC , and TGA. The synthesized polymers were soluble in common organic solvents , and formed smooth and uniform spin - coated thin films. All of the polymers studied were found to exhibit good thermal stability , losing less than 5% of their weight upon heating to approximately 350 ° C. Perylene-containing polymers showed higher field - effect mobilities than the corresponding PFDTBT or PFD2TBT polymers because of the enhanced π-π interaction between polymer chains upon the introduction of perylene units. Bulk heterojunction solar cells were fabricated with configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al. The devices using the perylene-containing polymers showed higher short - circuit currents , and fill factors than the corresponding PFDTBT or PFD2TBT devices. One of the fabricated devices using a perylene-containing copolymer showed a maximum power conversion efficiency of 3.16% , with a short circuit current density of 9.61 mA / cm^2 , open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , and fill factor of 41% . Extensive research has been carried out during the past decade on bulk heterojunction solar cells that utilize organic semiconducting materials. 1 The main advantages of organic photovoltaic devices ( OPVs ) are their lightweight , flexible nature , and their cost - effective manufacture by various printing technologies. The photoconversion process in OPVs is accomplished by efficient light absorption by conjugated polymers and accepting materials , charge separation at the interface of the donor polymer and the accepting materials , and subsequent charge collection at the electrodes. Matching the absorption of the conjugated polymer to the solar spectrum determines the ultimate performance of the solar cell. Among the variety of conjugated polymers that have been studied , poly(p-phenylenevinylene) ( PPV ) , 2 poly(alkylfluorene) ( PF ) , and polythiophene ( PT ) 3 derivatives are typical p - type electron donor materials. However , the performance of photovoltaic cells with these polymers is limited by their relatively large band gap energies , which are not yet optimized with respect to the solar spectrum. Therefore , the design and synthesis of new low - band gap polymers become very important to better harvest the solar spectrum , especially in the red and near - infrared ranges , which can lead to possible enhancements in the photocurrents of OPVs. 4 The most widely used approach for obtaining low - band gap structures is to utilize internal charge transfer ( ICT ) from an electron - donating to an electron - accepting moiety. 5-7 Some interesting structures using the ICT approach have been reported.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. ter-polymers
2. perylene units
3. PFDTBT polymers
4. PFD2TBT polymers
5. perylene-containing copolymer
6. PPV (poly(p-phenylenevinylene))
7. PF (poly(alkylfluorene))
8. PT (polythiophene)
9. ICT (internal charge transfer)

These are the entities mentioned in the paragraph that can be considered as "Material Names".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. perylene-containing polymers
2. PFDTBT polymers
3. PFD2TBT polymers

These are the only entities in the paragraph that can be considered as "Material Names".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| perylene-containing polymers |
| PFDTBT polymers |
| PFD2TBT polymers |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: their ter-polymers containing perylene units were synthesized using Suzuki coupling polymerization. The perylene units were introduced to improve the charge - transport ability by enhancing the π-π interaction between polymer chains. The resulting polymers were characterized by 1H NMR , elemental analysis , DSC , and TGA. The synthesized polymers were soluble in common organic solvents , and formed smooth and uniform spin - coated thin films. All of the polymers studied were found to exhibit good thermal stability , losing less than 5% of their weight upon heating to approximately 350 ° C. Perylene-containing polymers showed higher field - effect mobilities than the corresponding PFDTBT or PFD2TBT polymers because of the enhanced π-π interaction between polymer chains upon the introduction of perylene units. Bulk heterojunction solar cells were fabricated with configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al. The devices using the perylene-containing polymers showed higher short - circuit currents , and fill factors than the corresponding PFDTBT or PFD2TBT devices. One of the fabricated devices using a perylene-containing copolymer showed a maximum power conversion efficiency of 3.16% , with a short circuit current density of 9.61 mA / cm^2 , open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , and fill factor of 41% . Extensive research has been carried out during the past decade on bulk heterojunction solar cells that utilize organic semiconducting materials. 1 The main advantages of organic photovoltaic devices ( OPVs ) are their lightweight , flexible nature , and their cost - effective manufacture by various printing technologies. The photoconversion process in OPVs is accomplished by efficient light absorption by conjugated polymers and accepting materials , charge separation at the interface of the donor polymer and the accepting materials , and subsequent charge collection at the electrodes. Matching the absorption of the conjugated polymer to the solar spectrum determines the ultimate performance of the solar cell. Among the variety of conjugated polymers that have been studied , poly(p-phenylenevinylene) ( PPV ) , 2 poly(alkylfluorene) ( PF ) , and polythiophene ( PT ) 3 derivatives are typical p - type electron donor materials. However , the performance of photovoltaic cells with these polymers is limited by their relatively large band gap energies , which are not yet optimized with respect to the solar spectrum. Therefore , the design and synthesis of new low - band gap polymers become very important to better harvest the solar spectrum , especially in the red and near - infrared ranges , which can lead to possible enhancements in the photocurrents of OPVs. 4 The most widely used approach for obtaining low - band gap structures is to utilize internal charge transfer ( ICT ) from an electron - donating to an electron - accepting moiety. 5-7 Some interesting structures using the ICT approach have been reported.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Ter-polymers: This is a type of polymer that contains perylene units.
2. Perylene: This is a specific type of organic compound that is used to improve the charge-transport ability of polymers.
3. PFDTBT: This is a type of polymer that is used as a donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
4. PFD2TBT: This is another type of polymer that is used as a donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
5. PPV: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
6. PF: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
7. PT: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
8. ITO: This is a metal oxide material that is used as a transparent electrode in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
9. PSS: This is a conducting polymer that is used as a counter electrode in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
10. PC71BM: This is an organic molecule that is used as an acceptor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
11. TiOx: This is a metal oxide material that is used as a transparent electrode in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
12. Al: This is a metal that is used as an electrode in bulk heterojunction solar cells.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to the property name of materials in the paragraph:

1. Perylene: This is the specific type of organic compound that is used to improve the charge-transport ability of polymers.
2. PFDTBT: This is a type of polymer that is used as a donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
3. PFD2TBT: This is another type of polymer that is used as a donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
4. PPV: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
5. PF: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
6. PT: This is a type of conjugated polymer that is used as an electron donor material in bulk heterojunction solar cells.
